Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Caca12
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. Hotel is not that close to center of Rome, its located 10-15 minutes from Central train station Termini, but you can get train schedule in hotel and trains are on time. Only bad thing is that you don't have night trains, but I was too tired of walking through the city that I had no strength to stay at night :) Also, 3 train stops in opposite direction from center of Rome and you are on beach :) Definitely go to Ladispoli!! Anyways, hotel is great - big rooms, very clean, bathroom also, big restaurant, good food, big fantastic pool..Reception staff was exceptionally polite, very friendly and very professional. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone with more than 2 days to spare - especially familys with children as the pool is ideal for them .

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews make it sound”
Reviews.Author: pa2093
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group during a tour through Italy. I was nervous about staying here after seeing the reviews but hotel choice was out of my control. We had a suite that fit 3 people. It was very large and the maid provided extra towels and soaps knowing that there were 3 people staying in the room. Our room's air conditioning was not that good so our room stayed pretty warm throughout our stay. I saw other rooms that people in our group were staying in and they were ok. They were smaller but overall not that bad. I do not suggest eating at the hotel. As mentioned in previous reviews, the staff is not the friendliest and they don't look happy with their job. The food at the hotel was ok. The breakfast was very light as most Italian breakfasts are. The hotel is not in a convienient location to downtown Rome, but since we were with a group and we had a bus we could live with it. The pool area is very nice. There were lots of chairs and they had a bar. The only downside is that you have to use the towels from your room. Many of the other reviews say that there is lots of mold, however I did not see mold anywhere during our stay. The wi-fi is free but it only really works well in the lobby. Overall, this hotel was pretty good. I wouldn't stay here again unless I was with a group.

Reviews.Title: “please dont book”
Reviews.Author: daryl1963
Reviews.Content: this was without a doubt the worst hotel we have ever stayed at , thay moaned at us for staying too long !!! the receptionist was v rude .the room had non of the advertised facilities ?? it was dirty grubby & 30 years out of date .the reception constantly told us we should think are self lucky to stay there at th price we paid. pluses it as a swimming pool my advise stay somewhere else .a treck to city centre

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location, unpleasant staff, and mold everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: WarriorPrincess52
Reviews.Content: The Summit Hotel is very inconvenient if you want to travel to the center of the city. To get to the Spanish Steps, we needed to take a bus and transfer to a Metro A line. And to travel to the Vatican, we needed to take yet another mode of transportation, which was a train and it was not the metro. The Hotel is on top of a hill requiring a good 8-10 minute walk from the hotel to the main road which means if you walk down, you must also walk up after a full day of walking. Then, to top it off, the hotel itself is old, smelly, and full of mold. The elevator did not work so we had to drag our baggage up the stairs to get to the floor. The stairwell walls were very dirty, scuzzy, and carpeting was very warn out. Once we got to our floor, the carpeting which was attached to the lower portion of the wall, was falling off. Then, we entered the room and what a surprise. The shower area was full of mold everywhere. I was very concerned with what I saw. Although, the ratings are different in Italy than in the US, it deserved maybe a 1 if even that. The TV did not have any english speaking channels and had access to maybe 3 channels. Unfortunately, we did not have access to the news. The shower was situated in such a way that it was difficult to get into and out of the stall. Had to raise legs at least 2 feet in order to get in. It would be very difficult for an elderly person to get in and out. The food was also bad -- but because it was a tour we did not have choices of dishes we were being served. Either way, the staff serving the food was not very pleasant, and we were always waiting for them to bring out coffee, which we had to serve ourselves anyway. To sum it up -- it is inconvenient, lacks personality or old style charm that I have seen in Rome on previous trips, and they really need to get rid of the mold.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible”
Reviews.Author: dantecik
Reviews.Content: Everything is terrible about this hotel. Stay away from it! Location is awful. You have to walk to the station for about 15 minutes then you have to get 247 bus to the metro station!! If you miss the bus wait 45 minutes! Or train it is all same..And the staff is worst then terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “4 gwiazdkowy hotel z okropnymi obiadokolacjami i rdzą na suficie w jadalni ?”
Reviews.Author: mateo9975
Reviews.Content: Na moje oko i przeżycia po pobycie w tym hotelu muszę się wypowiedzieć, jedzenie - śniadania są w porządku, obiadokolacje masakra zupy to istna lura, makaron z pastą, trzeci dzień z rzędu zniechęca, odgrzewane puszkowe jedzenie , sufit w jadalni dziury z wystającymi kablami, basen choć nie pora na kompanie to zaniedbany m.in. leżak w basenie. Z tych 4 gwiazdek 2 musiały zostać doklejone. Nie polecam chyba że ktoś nie ma wygórowanych wymagań.

Reviews.Title: “False advertised, Stay away from this dump.”
Reviews.Author: Don2088
Reviews.Content: Description of hotel falsely states that there is comp. transportation to and from FCO airport and V-City. This is not ture. The hotel staff is rude and un accomidating to its guests. If you book with Travelocity or Hotels .com or other internet booking agent, your are treated second class. Pick and other hotel in Rome. I have stayed many places in this wonderful city. The Summit is on the bottom of the list for sure. Avoid the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single positive! Terrible and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Octopus1401
Reviews.Content: Where to start... The room: at £200/night for a "suite", you would expect a minimum of comfort. For example, you would expect NOT to be able to hear every word of a phone call made next door by somebody obviously trying to keep his voice down. You would expect the mattress NOT to feel like it needed to be changed a few years ago. You would expect towels that still have thread to them, a shower that does not consist of a showerhead in a bath with a flimsy screen. Above all, you would NOT expect to smell whatever other clients do in their toilet, and I mean: whatever.... The pool. For a start, it is not cleaned daily. There is a grand total of two umbrellas available for about 30 loungers. There is no towels provided, you are requested to use your room's towels, and have to pay a €5 surcharge to get them changed afterwards. It is cold and usually noisy from sound checks for the daily evening private party (this hotel caters mostly for parties and conferences). The food. Unbelievable but true, it is worse than the rest. The €22 buffet option offers a bad selection of salad, one awful hot dish with as little meat as they can get away with, and some days no dessert (or they keep it in the kitchen, you have to ask for it, the waiter then has to ask his manager for permission to bring you what you have paid for). Coffee is as bad which is a rare occurence in Italy. I was not brave enough to try the wine.... The service. With a couple of exceptions in the restaurant, the rest of the staff clearly hate their job and make sure you do know about it. The location. Yes, as per the other reviews, awful. Not only far from everything, but in an area that is void of bars, restaurants, shops, and which does not look safe enough to wander at night. All in all, avoid at all costs!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Forget this hotel, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: yvonnecolebert
Reviews.Content: Forget staying at this hotel. I originally chose it because when I was first planning our trip to Italy, the site I was on showed a shuttle that picked you up at the metro station, and then a shuttle showing to the airport. I wanted to stay close to the airport the night before leaving so I didn't have to worry about getting their on time. While, apparently, the site I was on showing a shuttle from the hotel to the Metro was not their's and doesn't happen unless you contact them prior (no mention of that in the ad I saw, the ad I saw gave a time table). We ended up taking a taxi which cost 20 Euro. The free shuttle to the airport is a joke, our plane left at 12:30 pm so we had to be at the airport at 9:30 am, the shuttle to the airport goes from the hotel at 07:20, 16:45 and ?, which meant we had to catch the 07:20 or get a cab. Breakfast was at 07:00 so needless to say, it was a quick grab something, gulp down your tea/coffee and go. The reception was defensive, the hotel, was old, needing a paint job (dirty walls), but the room itself was clean and comfy. the pizza by the pool was really good. I difinitely will not be reconmending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: Magyan
Reviews.Content: Room was adequate - decoration dated, needed a paint job and some minor repairs, but it was clean. No safe. Pool was nice - they could do with more lounge chairs. Breakfast was OK, except for scrambled eggs - bright yellow and runny. More fruit would have been nice. Did not eat at hotel restaurant - too expensive. We went to the nearby supermarket - down the hill, turn right, across the bridge - 5-10 mins. We bought cooked chicken and a salad and had a picnic by the pool. If you are reasonably fit (we are in our 60's), the walk down the hill from the hotel is easy. You can turn right at the bottom to the bus stop and catch the bus to Cornelia station, but it is a lot quicker to turn left and walk under the subway to Aurelia station. Trains run every hour (10 mins to the hour when we were there). every 2 hours on Sundays and holidays. Pay on the train. We did not take the hotel shuttle into Rome. There is a shuttle bus to Fiumicino airport. We paid 35 Euros for a taxi to Ciampino airport. DO NOT let reception order a taxi for you - they will charge you 25% more (at least). If you just go outside the hotel, taxis arrive all the time. Wait for one and ask him to pick you up at the time you need - he will come back. This is not a 4 star hotel, but we found it OK for our needs. By the way, airfares back to North America from Rome are expensive. You can go to England on Easyjet or Ryanair for about $50. Spend a few days (or longer!) there and then get a cheap charter back home. That's what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but just too far from everything”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: As stated above really. It was the perfect place to relax after a hard day of sightseeing. The outdoor pizza restaurant and bar were fab. Oh and the beds were so comfy...had the best sleep ever at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “there are two airports and they shuttle only from ONE!”
Reviews.Author: scooter58
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they gave us directions to takea bus, then the metro, then another bus, and then a 10 minute walk to get to the hotel! The airport shuttle only is to one airport and we flew from London via Ryan air and it lands at a different airport. They gave us information when we arrived about train & bus service - an hour after waiting at the train station we learn it is a holiday & no train service. No explanation why the hotel did not tell us it was a holiday they day we arrived and that trains were not running and bus service was limited. Very frustrating first day. The restaurant service was impossibly slow as they catered to a wedding party and ignored us. Food was tasteless. The hotel definitely needs TLC, reasonably clean but beds were like rocks. The destination requires you to work at going into town as they only make 4 trips a day to Cornelia station - 2 in the morning, and 2 at night. Definitely not at request. They only want you to use their taxi reference, and there are less expensive cabs. There is a supermarket 10 minutes away and you can get water, pizza, fish, water, beer, ice cream etc there. The hotel is located a ten minute walk from the bus stop, and the hotel is at the peak of fairly steep driveway which for some might be a problem. Not negotiable - we asked for some consideration due to the lack of airport shuttle, and other misunderstandings but the staff there do not seem inclined to finding solutions to make tourists happy before they leave. I guess there are enough tourists who don't do research. The location is not way out of town though, it is only a short bus ride or short taxi ride into old Rome. This is not a four star hotel for service, or accomodation. We would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly Not a 4-Star.....”
Reviews.Author: combusus
Reviews.Content: The on-line company I booked this hotel through rated it a 4-star. Either I stayed at the wrong hotel, or they need their eyes tested!!! On my recent experience, I'd say its struggling to maintain a 2-star rating! We found the hotel staff to be courteous, polite and helpful, but it was all downhill after that. The room(s), whilst kept clean, had very dated decor. The en-suite bathroom was minute, with no room to swing a kitten, let alone a cat! The TV in our room was perched on top of the mini-bar, the remote was broken, and was never fixed during our stay, despite repeated requests. There were/are no facilities inside the rooms to make tea or coffee. Breakfast was basically a self-service cold buffet, with runny 'scrambled' eggs and bacon. Evening meals were an 'adventure' because despite ordering from the menu, we often received what the the chef 'thought' we had ordered. The portions sizes were suitable for a 10-year old, unfortunately we couldn't find any 10-year olds to give our meals to! The hotel is at the top of a hill, if you miss the am or pm shuttle to Cornelia metro station, there is a 10-minute walk to the bus-stop. Not so bad in the morning when going out, but a real chore in the evening when returning after a days sight-seeing. The shuttle was unpredictable as despite having a time-table, one day it would leave later than the scheduled time, the next day it would leave as per the time-table, so you never quite knew where you were. The Hotel has a swimming pool, but it wasn't clean, and we never saw anyone in it, despite some very hot days during our stay. If you are visiting Rome, its probably worth spending the extra to get a hotel closer to the centre. It makes sight-seeing, and travelling around a lot easier. If you must stay on the outskirts of Rome, we would not recommend staying here!!! Tourist Tip (i): When purchasing a 'multi-ticket' for combined metro & bus travel, they are available from the metro stations. however, the metro has no booking office staff, only ticket machines. The ticket machines only take the exact money for the required ticket, despite saying they give change, they don't! Also, we found that you can actually just walk through the metro gates to get down to the platform. Whilst there are machines you are supposed to 'swipe' your ticket through on both the metro and buses, after a while we 'did as the Romans do' and just got on the metro and buses without 'swiping' the ticket through the machine. Tourist Tip (ii): When visiting the Vatican, the early morning queues are long (try and get there by 8am), don't be conned by tour guides offering a fast-track entry, "Within 10-minutes of the doors opening", they say . They will charge €27.00 on top of the standard €13.00 Vatican entry price. Only go with a guided tour if you genuinely want to, and not just to get inside quicker. Once the doors open at 10am, and the queue starts to move, you will be inside pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “Summit Roma Should Be Downgraded to 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: millerLondon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel the reception staff were very helpful but the service from the bar and restaurant staff was to say the least appalling they gave the impression that they really did not want to be bothered by quests. The kitchen was in clear view of the restaurant via a glass wall it was interesting to see the chief smoking whilst cooking!! and the quests having to wait whilst the waiters finished on their mobile phones. We found the service to be a little too relaxed. We stood at the bar and waited for 9 mintues whilst the barman made himself a coffee. The hotel was tidy but dirty it needs a spring clean, the windows, mirrors and curtains are dusty. The hotel is a long way from the main drag on top of a hill. We only had to stay 3 nights if our visit had been longer we certainly would have changed hotels. This hotel is firmly a basic 2 star hotel. Maybe the restaurant/bar staff could use the training advice of the reception staff. Overall not a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shubhox
Reviews.Content: It claims to be a 4-star hotel but gives the service of a 2-star. The carpets were torn in the hallways, the wallpaper was coming out in some places, the staff was unfriendly - to give a few instances of the service. The television remote in our room was not working - they sent a repairman who fiddled with it for a few minutes and finally claimed it cannot be solved. To top it, there was no internet room/cyber cafe in the hotel. Thankfully enough, we were out the whole day - otherwise the torment would have been more. I recommend other genuine 4-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, terrible location.”
Reviews.Author: KOtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome after 3 days of stay from 4/1 to 4/3. I should have listened to fellow reviewers. Please do not waste your time and money on this hotel. Getting in and out of this hotel was a nightmare. From Termini station, we had to take Metro B line and waited for 246/247 bus. Please get off Cornelia station not Eur Aurelia station. We then had to walk up the hill. On second day, the shuttle bus did not even showed up @8 pm run. Plus, 2 out of 3 wake up call did not come on time. Please spend extra few dollars to find the ones closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Real Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from there,it's a shame what could be a great hotel to be such a bad experience.service not good at all,staff,the rooms,and the worst the restaurant staff. we were siiting for one hour and forty minutes and we left without eating.I will not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are several reasons for not staying in this hotel. I want to tell some of the problems we faced in there. The room we booked was terrible; it was old dusty and terribly hot with a broken AC and an antic refrigerator which wasn't working either. We immidiately asked the hotel stuff to change our room. After 1,5 hours of waiting we moved to a new room which at least had basic needs such as clean floors and a working AC. Needless to say we had expected a bit more from a 4 star hotel. Another problem we faced was really very rude of the hotel stuff. They told us that they were shuttling to the nearest subway station from the hotel in the morning and back to the hotel in evenings. Although we went to the subway with this shuttle bus, the bus never came to pick us back in evening. We waited there for 2 hours and then took an ordinary bus and then walked about 1 km to the hotel. Later we learned that the hotel bus never came because it was broken, however the hotel made us no apology for this. Another thing that made us feel terrible in this hotel was the hotel restaurant, we payed 4 euros for a salad made of only one tomato and a couple of green leafs. The location of the hotel is also not good for a Rome visit as it is not close to the city center at all and the transportation is terrible. Even if you have a car you woulnd't like to get in to the Rome city traffic anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down until they renovate the rooms. The smell of mildew and mold in the hallways and rooms is unbelievable. I was stuck there due to a tour, and it took 3 rooms until I found one that did not smell. The pool and restaurant were lovely, unfortunately, one cannot sleep and bathe there. If you can choose, choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 great days in Rome staying at the Summit Roma Hotel. Upon arrival at the airport we called the Hotel to collect us, they were there within 20 minutes, the shuttle service only runs at certain times so you must check before you go that your flight coincides with these times. We were greeted by friendly, helpful staff and were given an adequately large enough room for the four of us, which in turn was comfortable and clean. The restaurant by the pool was good, the staff were friendly and the service was quick, the food was nice, priced at what you would expect for a Hotel. After hard mornings of sightseeing it was a joy to come back and laze by the pool whilst the children played. The hotel is a trip outisde of Rome, but so accessible, there is the shuttle service which takes you directly to the Metro, limited places though. Alternatively, there are two regular buses, we found the train station at the bottom of the hill great, it takes you directly in and out of Rome, it also runs to Saint Marinello which is a beautiful beach resort, ask at Reception for the times, they were very helpful. We had a great few days staying at this hotel, the pool is a real treat in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible to find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel advises that it is near city centre. Don't believe it!! The shuttle bus didn't appear, it is not easy to find and the staff at reception were most unhelpful. The hotel itself is at the top of a hill and the railway station nearest doesn't have many trains. Underground is probably about 4 mils away although there is a bus (985) from Cornelia Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very unfriendly. Had to wait 3 hours at airport for their shuttle service. They would only come at certain times. Morning and late afternoon. We called them at 1:30 pm and they came at 4:30. After checking in, we were hungry but restaurant didn't open till 8:00 pm. They wern't ready at 8 and didn't let us in till 8:30. Lobby was beautiful, but rooms looked like they were never renovated. The beds were like sleeping on a board. The pillow didn't even help. Wallpaper was peeling off walls in our room. It was, however clean. Just really dreary.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling customer service from staff let down this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely if a bit out of the way. And it's a pity the staff weren't as nice as the hotel itself. Only found out the day before due to come home that there is an overground station 10 minutes walk away which took us to the heart of the city centre. However, it is not surprising the staff failed to mention this, given that their customer service was so shoddy. The rooms were beautiful - we were actually given one of the 5 suites which were immaculate, with fresh towels every day. Make sure you check and double check which airport you are due to fly home from. On our last day, we were told there is a shuttle bus to the airport. No mention was made by any staff of the name of the airport, although another party travelling in the bus with us checked with the driver and were told that the airport was correct. However, we ended up at the wrong one, and when I asked the driver how we could get to the correct one, he simply said "it's not my problem, you should have checked" and then turned his back on me! This was also the attitude of the unhelpful reception staff when we got back to the hotel. There was no help whatsoever and they refused to give us the hotel manager's name. What was even more ludicrous was the fact that the bus had to practically go past the correct airport on the way back to the hotel but because it "wasn't his route" he wouldn't take us. Luckily we made our flight by the skin of our teeth; the other party (with a baby) weren't so lucky...so all in all, the hotel was let down by the terrible quality of the customer service and rudeness of the driver (who incidentally only understood English when it suited him!)

Reviews.Title: “very hard to find”
Reviews.Author: yoda69
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was a bit of a nightmare, the easiest way is to get the over ground train to Stazione Roma. From there go under the station away from the bus terminas and turn left. The hotel is 300m on the right. Apart from the location and the un-reliable shuttle bus we loved this Hotel. The rooms were clean, the staff helpful and friendly and the breakfast was the best we had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother out of the way”
Reviews.Author: aah2bme
Reviews.Content: Having just got back (yesterday 18/3/05) from a 3 day stay in the Summit Roma Hotel. The following observations were made, This hotel is WELL WELL OUT OF THE WAY from the centre of Rome. The nearest station to it is Cornelia Metro station. There is a free shuttle bus that runs to this station from the hotel but be warned there is high chance there won't be enough room for you on the bus as spaces are limited, so you'll have to get a taxi ( 10 Euros) up to Cornelia station as they don't do a second runs. The metro line closes at 9 pm so if your planning a late night in the centre of Rome be prepared to cough up the 25 Euros back to the hotel by taxi. (Thanks for telling us that hotel people not! ) Also the last free shuttle service from Cornelia station to the hotel is at 8pm. The rooms are basic and if you like sleeping on plywood you'll love the beds. The showers have no shower curtains, so having a shower brings a new meaning to the term 'wet room '. Next time I'll take my snorkle and flip flops. The shuttle bus service times aren inconsistent, our room had ants and toilet flooded when there was a problem with the drains on more than one occasion. I am pleased to say that the hotel did not spoil my trip to Rome. It was beautiful city full of charming people and wonderful places visit just DON'T stay in this hotel.
